title: Want something for free? Solve this Riddle!
body:
THE RIDDLE HAS BEEN SOLVED!!! Try to figure it out before reading the answer below.

Hey guys.

I really enjoyed writing this riddle. Blazoir helped me come up with some ideas for the riddle and helped me create an outline. Thank you Blazoir.

Here we go! CHECK OUT THE POLL BELOW

*At times we ponder on things passed.*
*For all things we know, time will outlast.*
*As time drags on, our comfort gone,*
*All we can do is mourn and look on.*
 
*At the beginning the process begins,*
*Ends at the closing of all that has been.*
*It’s when, not if, not if, but when.*
*The wisest of all have serenity within.*
 
*An emptiness that cannot be filled*
*With fingers reaching that are not instilled*
*Never gives, always wants,*
*Haunting the bravest, it will daunt.*
 
*Of fingers clenched and foreheads drenched*
*Whether children to mothers or players benched*
*Those entrenched from comfort wrenched*
*Yearning and pleading will never be quenched.*
 
*Darkness thrives within our lives,*
*This riddle lets the darkness survive.*
*Struggle you may and put up a fight,*
*Until answered, there is no light.*

Good Luck!

As always, if you would like to join my growing list of people who want to be notified when a new riddle comes out, email me at

fritterztheriddler@gmail.com

If you would like to help me fund the prizes so my wife doesn't keep castrating me, I have a donation link on my stream:

www.twitch.tv/fritterzzz


I don't know what the prize should be for figuring out this riddle. It should be something good because this riddle is tough. Check out the poll, the option with the most votes at the time the riddle is answered is what the prize will be.

EDIT: My response to the poll:
http://webchutney.pk/content/uploads/2016/02/play.gif

Edit #2

At times we ponder on things passed.
For all things we know, time will outlast.
As time drags on, our comfort gone,
All we can do is mourn and look on.

An introductory stanza suggesting the answer is from the past.

At the beginning the process begins,
Ends at the closing of all that has been.
It’s when, not if, not if, but when.
The wisest of all have serenity within.

This paragraph is about death - The process of death starts at birth. The process of death ends with death. It is when not if. The wisest have accepted they will inevitably die.

An emptiness that cannot be filled
With fingers reaching that are not instilled
Never gives, always wants,
Haunting the bravest, it will daunt.

This paragraph is about fire. - Fire is an abyss that never stops as long as there is food for it. Fingers reaching and not instilled. The rest is easy to see.

Of fingers clenched and foreheads drenched
Whether children to mothers or players benched
Those entrenched from comfort wrenched
Yearning and pleading will never be quenched.

This stanza is about the word grasp. - children and mothers grasping each other. Players benched grasping for greatness. Yearning and pleading suggested grasping.

Darkness thrives within our lives,
This riddle lets the darkness survive.
Struggle you may and put up a fight,
Until answered, there is no light.

Concluding paragraph suggesting it is really hard.

replies.body: Is it {{champion:82}}?
2 times guessed already.
You only need to guess Mordekaiser once you fool!

FUDGE DUDE WAIT IS IT SOULSTEALER VAYNE?! OR DEATHFIRE GRASP?

Explanation: I honestly saw someone put Deathfire Touch, and I thought about it. Re-read the riddle, and it sounded like death, SOMETHING to do with death and darkness. Read it again.

"At the beginning the process begins,
Ends at the closing of all that has been.
It’s when, not if, not if, but when.
The wisest of all have serenity within."

Closing I interpreted as either the hands of the staff closing or when you used it's active and blew someone up, the closing would mean active is down/enemy is killed.

It "ends" when the game is over, or when the enemy is killed. Possibly also when you buy it and harness it's power.

Figured I'd should mention before I continue, I used every item death related and looked it up on wiki for the image/passives/actives, and Deathfire Grasp seemed to be the most accurate.

"An emptiness that cannot be filled
With fingers reaching that are not instilled
Never gives, always wants,
Haunting the bravest, it will daunt."

The hand on the staff/hand thing has magic on it, but the hands are wilted, as if it needs more but can't get it. Hands are self-explanatory, they're reaching out for the magic that they cannot get, the haunt the bravest (enemy mages/the mage you're playing, as it is an assassin mage burst item)

"Whether children to mothers or players benched"

A lot of mages used to use this item, from Ahri to well, a child, Annie, and Orianna, who always wanted to join the Field of Justice as a Champion or "player."

The rest was just me going "IT HAS TO BE" and just guessing it cause if I was wrong I could just re-evaluate.

I don't believe anyone answered Deathfire Grasp before you. Someone guessed Deathfire Touch.

DEATHFIRE GRASP IS THE CORRECT ANSWER!!!

Explanation in an Edit.
Wooooo It's Out!!!
Responding to all the guesses is hurting my brain.

I'll help you out.
Gee Fritterz. What do you want to do tomoro? 
Shall we give a hint...or enjoy their suffering and turmoil for free animal crackers

Got it. Our mission: Beat Laughing Fish and Malicious Metal with our super fun and easy riddle!
right?
Super fun and easy.... I think there are many here who would disagree with you.
Ok. How about...Interesting intriguing Simple but complex literature work of art meant to create turmoil and tears
and can cause serious injury or death. Should we have everyone sign waivers before they guess?
I think its too late.
Be ready for the impending law suits.
Isn't it lawsuits?
No you misunderstand. They will send us suits. Specifically made for lawyers.
ugh. I hate suits. That show is...not for me

i hate my fucking life. 1 minute earlier and i would've gotten 1350 rp.
fuck this game. fuck my life. fk me wooooooow.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-CYd2AYYavo

would you like some virtual animal crackers? They are humping!

http://i.imgur.com/1Pxsa0e.jpg?2
if it makes you feel any better somehow, you are the amazing being that just got me to search what thats from and am now watching this amazing showmatch
Is It Nasus? {{champion:75}}
The cycle of saying "that is not the right answer" continues...

I'm gonna say either death or the cycle of life and death.

>At times we ponder on things _**passed**_.
For all things we know, time will outlast.
As time drags on, our comfort gone,
All we can do is _**mourn**_ and look on.

referring to death and how time goes on after we die.

>At the beginning the process begins,
Ends at the closing of all that has been.
It’s when, not if, not if, but when.
The wisest of all have serenity within.

This is just describing cycles in general and how if you know death is coming you get a sense of peace.

>An emptiness that cannot be filled
With fingers reaching that are not instilled
Never gives, always wants,
Haunting the bravest, it will daunt.

It makes people sad when you die, an emptiness in their lives, death reaches with fingers, death is daunting and feared.

>Of fingers clenched and foreheads drenched
Whether children to mothers or players benched
Those entrenched from comfort wrenched
Yearning and pleading will never be quenched.
(impressive rhyme btw)

Tension/fear, 2nd line no clue, you can plead but you'll still die.

>Darkness thrives within our lives,
This riddles lets the darkness survive.
Struggle you may and put up a fight,
Until answered, there is no light.

darkness=sadness, rest=ending

---

This is my guess and reasoning
This is the closest guess so far. You are missing pieces to the puzzle.
Shoot, I was going to guess death too!
It is definitely in the right direction.

Beautifully written. Trying to think of an answer rofl.

So how does this work? First person to get it gets prize?

Gah. Well it seems like whatever it is, it isn't exactly ... liked. So might a well guess the most hated thing in league ATM (apparently).



Dynamic queue?

Is it the summoner?

The riddle starts off using we alot. That means it is not a singular character, but a collective. It also finishes off with our. And it looks at game from an out side perspective. "Of fingers clenched and foreheads drenched Whether children to mothers or players benched" That is a direct reference to the individual playing the game. The always taking and never giving. The yearning that will never be answered. It all describes the game, however the focus is on the players inner struggle.
Nope sorry. look at the comment by iguy
Damn this is tough

Hecarim

Or

Yorick?
Good guesses but no.
The grim reaper, or Kindred? Theyre kind of the same thing. lol.
People guessed kindred already.
Oh, maybe I should read more responses before I blurt more out. XD.
don't feel bad, there are A LOT of answers, reading through them is gonna take a while, and people might guess your ideas before you if you scroll down all the way
Try responding to them all. *points finger gun to his head and pulls the trigger....*
Lol, well this is fun! Works slow right now so Im just wracking my brains out. I reread the thing like a billion times.

People are guessing a bunch of League stuff, but based off of your other riddles, its not a League answer is it? 

Is it the unknown?
This one is league related.
IT WAS {{champion:27}} ALL ALONG!
How many guesses do we have?
As many as you want.

Thresh's lantern
More specifically dark star thresh's lantern.
That's my guess.
Good guess! But no.
darn, no box of animal crackers for me.

At the rate things are going there will be no prize.

Just kidding. Even if "no prize bwahaha" wins I will likely choose the next option down with the most votes.
